710353f-a.title: Manhattan: 9th Avenue - 27th Street (West)
710353f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, from W. 27th to 28th Streets, as viewed
across the easterly portion of Chelsea Park from the roof of
No. 424 W. 27th Street. The P. ~. Church of the Holy Apostles
is at the S. E. corner of 28th Street.
March 24, 1929
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

718669f-b.title: Manhattan: 27th Street (West) - 9th Avenue
718669f-b.text:
Chelsea Park : A set of 3 views, northeastward from various
points on West 27th Street between Ninth ard Tenth Avenues, showing
the rear of Public School No. 33 and a Public Health Station, both
located in the easterly haif of this park. Across same apnears the
tovn of the Empire State Bldg. and the spire of the P.E. Church of
the Hoiy Aposties; the latter is located at the S.E. corner of Ninth
Avenue and W. 28th street and has a very irteresting history, being
representative of a single individuais tenacity of purpose and the
reward thereof.
IR 1937 the Board of Education proposed to erect a new school
here to replace that one shown, but decided not to. Note the 1 story
free rilk station seen in the foreground.
Aumust 4, 1938.
Vies 1,2 and 3.
P. 1. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTI AIS.

718671f-a.title: Manhattan: 27th Street - 9th Avenue
718671f-a.text:
Chelsea Park, looking towards Ninth Avenue from the 27th Street
side. The Protestant Epiecopal Church of the Holy Apostles
stands on the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and 28th Street.
July 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710351f-b.title: Manhattan: 9th Avenue - 27th Street (West)
710351f-b.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 27th Street, showing
the easterly aide of Chelsea Park, the Publio Bath (at No. 407-13
W. 28th Street), the new steel structure of the Post Office's Parcel
Post Office and the Ninth Avenue ''El.'' The park occupies the entire
block between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, extending from 27th to 28th
Streets.
View 2 shows only the area between W. 28th and 30th Streets
of which the second block is entrely occupied by the rising
Post Office builoing.
May 15, 1932
View: 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTI NS
